Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a drab-coloured coarse pottery vessel, the exterior is covered with a red/brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in places, containing part of a contract, perhaps for cultivation.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.135-6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87649) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87649)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 165 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
